docs.title: Datu AI Analyst
docs.text:
Datu Core is a Data AI analyst server which is simple to use with your data sources.

First, install the Datu Core server:

pip install "datu-core[postgres,sqldb]"

Then follow next steps.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Lightweight talk to data: A simple application that can talk with your data.
  • Production ready: Deploy anywhere whether it is in on-premises or cloud.
  • Safety and security as a priority: Protecting the data while interacting with llm.

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Ready to learn more? Check out these resources:

docs.title: Warning!
docs.text: Datu is in pilot and preview. During this preview period we welcome your feedback. API's may change as we refine the SDK based on user experiences.

docs.title: Configurations to set
docs.text: All the configurations that can be used listed below with their description, default values and possible values. set them using environment variables.

docs.title: Host
docs.text:
Host where your application will be running.

DATU_HOST=0.0.0.0

docs.title: Port
docs.text:
Port where your application listens to.

DATU_PORT=8000

docs.title: Openai key
docs.text:
OpenAI llm key.

DATU_OPENAI_API_KEY=

docs.title: Schema refresh threshold days
docs.text:
Refresh schema in x days.

DATU_SCHEMA_REFRESH_THRESHOLD_DAYS=2

docs.title: Schema cache file
docs.text:
Store schema cache to.

DATU_SCHEMA_CACHEC_FILE=schema_cache.json

docs.title: Schema categorical detection
docs.text:
Detect categorical columns.

DATU_SCHEMA_CATEGORICAL_DETECTION=true

docs.title: Schema sample limit
docs.text:
Schema sample limit to determine categorical values.

DATU_SAMPLE_LIMIT=1000

docs.title: Schema categorical threshold
docs.text:
Threshold for column values to be considered as categorical.

DATU_SCHEMA_CATEGORICAL_THRESHOLD=10

docs.title: SchemaRAG Engine
docs.text:
Extract relevant part of schema based on user query. Set to True to activate.

DATU_ENABLE_SCHEMA_RAG=False

docs.title: DBT profiles
docs.text:
Datasource profiles.yml.

DATU_DBT_PROFILES=

docs.title: Datu AI Analyst
docs.text: This quickstart guide shows you how to spin up your Datu server, add datasources and integrate mcp servers to your agent and emit debug logs. After completing this guide you can deploy to production and running at scale.

docs.title: Install Datu from PyPI.
docs.text:
First, ensure that you have Python 3.11+ installed.

We'll create a virtual environment to install the Datu and its dependencies in to.

python -m venv .venv

And activate the virtual environment:

  • macOS / Linux: source .venv/bin/activate
  • Windows (CMD): .venv\Scripts\activate.bat
  • Windows (PowerShell): .venv\Scripts\Activate.ps1

Next we'll install the datu-core server package:

pip install "datu-core[postgres]"

docs.title: How to add datasources
docs.text:
As per the current design, the application will fetch all the schema that is listed in the profiles.yml. Place profile.yml in the current directory or home directory for the application to fetch or set DATU_DBT_PROFILES="path/profiles.yml". Structure of profiles.yml

my_sources:
  target: dev-postgres # Target is used to select the datasource that is currently active. Change this if you would like to use a different datasource.
  outputs:
    dev-postgres:
      type: postgres

      host: "{{ env_var('DB_HOST', 'localhost') }}"  # if a environment variable is supplied that gets priority. This is useful for not hardcoding.

      port: 5432
      user: postgres
      password: postgres
      dbname: my_sap_bronze
      schema: bronze
    dev-sqlserver:
      type: sqlserver
      driver: 'ODBC Driver 18 for SQL Server' # Mandatory for sqlserver.
      host: localhost
      port: 1433
      user: sa
      password: Password123!
      dbname: my_sap_bronze
      schema: bronze

docs.title: How to run datu?
docs.text: After creating the datasources profiles.yml.

docs.title: 🔧 Environment Variables
docs.text:
set the following environment variables:

  • DATU_OPENAI_API_KEY – your OpenAI API key
  • DATU_DBT_PROFILES – path to your profiles.yml

Then run

datu

docs.title: Debug logs
docs.text:
To enable debug logs in Datu server .

Environment variables: Set DATU_LOGGING_LEVEL="DEBUG"

docs.title: Datasources Overview
docs.text: The directory provides a collection of configurations to help you get started with connecting data sources with Datu.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: With Datu, you can quickly connect to your data sources and turn raw information into actionable insights.

docs.title: How to add datasources
docs.text:
As per the current design the application will fetch all the schema that is listed in the profiles.yml. It is to avoid fetching the schema every single time.But it will only work on the target datasource that is selected.

Structure of profiles.yml

datu_demo:
  target: dev-postgres # Target is used to select the datasource that is currently active. Change this if you would like to use a different datasource.
  outputs:
    dev-postgres:
      type: postgres

      host: "{{ env_var('DB_HOST', 'localhost') }}"  # if a environment variable is supplied that gets priority. This is useful for not hardcoding.

      port: 5432
      user: postgres
      password: postgres
      dbname: my_sap_bronze
      schema: bronze
    dev-sqlserver:
      type: sqlserver
      driver: 'ODBC Driver 18 for SQL Server' # Mandatory for sqlserver.
      host: localhost
      port: 1433
      user: sa
      password: Password123!
      dbname: my_sap_bronze
      schema: bronze

docs.title: About profiles.yml
docs.text:
Datu core needs profiles.yml file that contains all the datasources configured. If you have used dbt,this is somewhat like to their profiles.yml though not exaclty the same.

<profile-name>:
  target: <target-name> # this is the default target
  outputs:
    <target-name>:
      type: <postgres | sqlserver | other>
      schema: <schema_identifier>

      ### Look for each datasources specific variables
      ...

      ...

<profile-name>: # additional profiles
  ...

docs.title: env_var
docs.text: You can use env_var with any attribute in the profiles.yml outputs section to load configuration values from environment variables.

docs.title: Postgres as a datasource
docs.text:
Install datucore with extras postgres

pip install "datu-core[postgres]"

In profiles.yml

dev-postgres:
    type: postgres
    host: [hostname]
    user: [username]
    password: [password]
    port: [port]
    dbname: [database name]
    schema: [schema]

docs.title: Sqlserver as a datasource
docs.text:
Install datucore with extras postgres

pip install "datu-core[sqldb]"

For sqlserver to work you have to make sure the below ODBC driver is installed on your machine according to the Operating System.

Install ODBC driver

In profiles.yml

dev-sqlserver:
    type: sqlserver
    driver: 'ODBC Driver 18 for SQL Server' # Mandatory for sqlserver.
    host: [hostname]
    user: [username]
    password: [password]
    port: [port]
    dbname: [database name]
    schema: [schema]

docs.title: Deploying Datu AI Analyst as container service
docs.text: Use below recommended method to run Datu application as container service.

docs.title: Containerization
docs.text:
To deploy your Datu, you need to containerize it using Podman or Docker. The Dockerfile defines how your application is packaged and run. Below is an example Docker file that installs all needed dependencies, the application, and configures the FastAPI server to run via unicorn dockerfile.

FROM python:3.11-slim
SHELL ["/bin/bash", "-c"]

RUN apt-get update && \
    apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends build-essential \
    curl \
    apt-utils \
    gnupg2 &&\
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* && \
    pip install --upgrade pip

RUN curl https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc | apt-key add -
RUN curl https://packages.microsoft.com/config/debian/11/prod.list > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mssql-release.list

RUN apt-get update
RUN env ACCEPT_EULA=Y apt-get install -y msodbcsql18
WORKDIR /app
RUN pip install "datu-core[postgres,sqldb]"
ENTRYPOINT [] 
CMD ["uvicorn", "datu.main:app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "8000", "--reload"]

docs.title: Infrastructure
docs.text: For running Datu application smoothly, make sure you are allocated about 1GB of CPU and 2GB of memory atleast.For configurable variables checkout the quickstart/configurations section.
